required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Musculoskeletal Symptoms in the Cambridge NIHR BioResource
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Musculoskeletal Symptoms in the Cambridge NIHR BioResource

lead_sponsor.agency: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

clinical_study.source: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

brief_summary.textblock:
Musculoskeletal diseases, such as osteoarthritis, represent a large proportion of the global burden of disease with hip and knee osteoarthritis alone being the 11th greatest cause of disease burden.
The purpose of this study is to determine the level of musculoskeletal symptoms in members of the Cambridge National Institute for Health Research (NIHR) BioResource and see if this is associated with their possession of genetic markers that have been identified as being associated with osteoarthritis.
This will allow us to determine the real level of musculoskeletal symptoms in this large cohort of volunteers and provide basic information that could be used to facilitate further musculoskeletal research in the NIHR BioResource population.

detailed_description.textblock:
All active members of the Cambridge NIHR BioResource will be approached.
They will be sent an email outlining the purpose of the study and asking that if they would like to take part to please complete the online questionnaire which will be linked to in the email.
For those individuals who agree to participate and complete the questionnaire, the Cambridge NIHR BioResource will provide the genetic marker information it already holds for specific markers that are known to be associated with osteoarthritis.

primary_outcome.description: Possession (or not) of specific genetic markers for osteoarthritis (obtained from information already held by the NIHR BioResource)

secondary_outcome.description: Identification of those with particular musculoskeletal injuries and conditions for future studies

arm_group.description: Any BioResource member who consents to take part in the study and completes the study questionnaire.

intervention.description: A questionnaire regarding musculoskeletal past medical history and current symptoms.

study_pop.textblock: All members of the Cambridge NIHR BioResource

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Member of the NIHR BioResource
- Willing to consent to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous self-report of osteoarthritis on joining BioResource

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Orthopaedic Surgery / Head of Department

patient_data.ipd_description: Sharing of participant level data does not fall within the consent or ethical approval of the study.
